2025-08-06 23:31:05
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 2)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from datetime import datetime import time # Extract author information from workspace files print("=== EXTRACTING AUTHOR INFORMATION FROM WORKSPACE FILES ===") # Load the author analysis file to get complete list of California immigration scholars author_analysis_file = 'workspace/california_immigration_analysis_20250806_232732.json' with open(author_analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: author_data = json.load(f) print(f"Loading author data from: {author_analysis_file}") print(f"Total unique authors found in previous research: {author_data['total_unique_authors']}") # Extract the complete list of potential authors potential_authors = author_data['potential_authors'] print("\nComplete list of California immigration scholars to cross-reference:") for i, author in enumerate(potential_authors, 1): author_name = author.get('name', 'Unknown') confidence = author.get('confidence', 'Unknown') source = author.get('source', 'Unknown') print(f"{i:2d}. {author_name} (Confidence: {confidence}, Source: {source})") # Create a clean list of author names for searching author_names = [author.get('name', '') for author in potential_authors if author.get('name')] print(f"\nExtracted {len(author_names)} author names for Bancroft Library cross-reference") # Key target authors mentioned in PLAN target_authors = ['John Haskell Kemble', 'James Miller Guinn'] print(f"\nKey target authors from PLAN: {target_authors}") # Verify target authors are in our list for target in target_authors: if any(target.lower() in name.lower() for name in author_names): print(f"‚úÖ {target} found in author list") else: print(f"‚ùå {target} NOT found in author list") print("\n=== SEARCHING FOR BANCROFT LIBRARY MANUSCRIPT COLLECTION GUIDES ===") print("Focus: Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence from Mexican-American War 1846") print("Cross-reference: California immigration scholars with Bancroft Library guide contributors") # Define search queries for Bancroft Library manuscript guides bancroft_search_queries = [ 'Bancroft Library manuscript collection guides Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo', 'Guides to manuscript collections Bancroft Library University California Vallejo', 'Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence Mexican-American War 1846 Bancroft', 'Bancroft Library Vallejo documents donated manuscript collection', 'University of California Bancroft manuscript guides Vallejo papers', 'Mariano Vallejo correspondence 1846 Mexican War Bancroft Library collection' ] # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Store all search results all_bancroft_results = [] print(f"\nExecuting {len(bancroft_search_queries)} targeted searches for Bancroft Library guides...") for i, query in enumerate(bancroft_search_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(bancroft_search_queries)}: {query}") print("-" * 80) # Try multiple search approaches search_urls = [ f"https://www.google.com/search?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}", f"https://duckduckgo.com/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}" ] for j, search_url in enumerate(search_urls, 1): print(f" Approach {j}: {'Google' if 'google' in search_url else 'DuckDuckGo'}") try: response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Extract search results if 'google' in search_url: # Google search results results = soup.find_all('div', class_='g') print(f" Found {len(results)} Google results") for k, result in enumerate(results[:5], 1): # Top 5 results title_elem = result.find('h3') link_elem = result.find('a') snippet_elem = result.find('span', class_='aCOpRe') or result.find('div', class_='VwiC3b') title = title_elem.get_text() if title_elem else 'No title' link = link_elem.get('href') if link_elem else 'No link' snippet = snippet_elem.get_text() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' print(f" Result {k}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" Link: {link}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}..." if len(snippet) > 150 else f" Snippet: {snippet}") # Check for Bancroft Library relevance combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}".lower() bancroft_indicators = ['bancroft', 'manuscript', 'collection', 'guide', 'vallejo', 'university of california'] relevance_score = sum(1 for indicator in bancroft_indicators if indicator in combined_text) if relevance_score >= 3: print(f" üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE (Score: {relevance_score}/{len(bancroft_indicators)})") # Store result all_bancroft_results.append({ 'search_query': query, 'search_method': 'Google' if 'google' in search_url else 'DuckDuckGo', 'result_number': k, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) print() else: # DuckDuckGo results (simpler structure) results = soup.find_all('div', class_='result') print(f" Found {len(results)} DuckDuckGo results") for k, result in enumerate(results[:3], 1): # Top 3 results title_elem = result.find('h2') or result.find('a') link_elem = result.find('a') snippet_elem = result.find('div', class_='snippet') title = title_elem.get_text() if title_elem else 'No title' link = link_elem.get('href') if link_elem else 'No link' snippet = snippet_elem.get_text() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' print(f" Result {k}: {title}") print(f" Link: {link}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:100]}..." if len(snippet) > 100 else f" Snippet: {snippet}") print() # Store result all_bancroft_results.append({ 'search_query': query, 'search_method': 'DuckDuckGo', 'result_number': k, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet }) else: print(f" ‚ùå HTTP error: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚ùå Search error: {str(e)}") # Brief pause between requests time.sleep(2) print("=" * 80) time.sleep(3) # Longer pause between different queries print(f"\n=== BANCROFT LIBRARY SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY ===") print(f"Total search results collected: {len(all_bancroft_results)}") # Save comprehensive search results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") bancroft_results_file = f"workspace/bancroft_library_vallejo_search_{timestamp}.json" with open(bancroft_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_focus': 'Bancroft Library manuscript collection guides for Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence', 'target_period': '1846 Mexican-American War', 'cross_reference_authors': author_names, 'key_target_authors': target_authors, 'total_queries_executed': len(bancroft_search_queries), 'total_results_found': len(all_bancroft_results), 'search_queries': bancroft_search_queries, 'all_search_results': all_bancroft_results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"üìÅ Bancroft Library search results saved to: {bancroft_results_file}") # Analyze results for high-relevance Bancroft Library connections high_relevance_results = [r for r in all_bancroft_results if r.get('relevance_score', 0) >= 3] print(f"\nüéØ High-relevance results found: {len(high_relevance_results)}") if high_relevance_results: print("\nMost promising Bancroft Library manuscript guide connections:") for i, result in enumerate(high_relevance_results[:5], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['search_query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Relevance Score: {result.get('relevance_score', 'N/A')}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"\nüìã NEXT PHASE: Cross-reference author analysis") print(f"üéØ Goal: Identify which California immigration scholars contributed to Bancroft Library manuscript guides") print(f"üìö Focus: Guides specifically indexing Vallejo's 1846 wartime correspondence and donated documents") print(f"\nüîç Ready to analyze specific Bancroft Library URLs and cross-reference with author list")
Execution Output

2025-08-06 23:31:05
Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - NameError on line 39 due to undefined variable 'target' in the list comprehension. The code successfully extracted author information from workspace files and identified 17 California immigration scholars including the key target authors John Haskell Kemble and James Miller Guinn. However, the script crashed before reaching the Bancroft Library search phase due to a simple variable scope error in the target author verification loop. The error prevents any of the planned Bancroft Library manuscript guide searches from executing. **PLAN** alignment: 30% complete - author extraction successful but core search functionality blocked by syntax error. Immediate fix needed: Change 'target' to 'target_author' in the list comprehension on line 39, or use a proper for loop structure. Once fixed, the comprehensive Bancroft Library search queries are ready to execute and should produce the needed cross-reference data.
Python Code python
import os import json import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from datetime import datetime import time # Extract author information from workspace files print("=== EXTRACTING AUTHOR INFORMATION FROM WORKSPACE FILES ===") # Load the author analysis file to get complete list of California immigration scholars author_analysis_file = 'workspace/california_immigration_analysis_20250806_232732.json' with open(author_analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: author_data = json.load(f) print(f"Loading author data from: {author_analysis_file}") print(f"Total unique authors found in previous research: {author_data['total_unique_authors']}") # Extract the complete list of potential authors potential_authors = author_data['potential_authors'] print("\nComplete list of California immigration scholars to cross-reference:") for i, author in enumerate(potential_authors, 1): author_name = author.get('name', 'Unknown') confidence = author.get('confidence', 'Unknown') source = author.get('source', 'Unknown') print(f"{i:2d}. {author_name} (Confidence: {confidence}, Source: {source})") # Create a clean list of author names for searching author_names = [author.get('name', '') for author in potential_authors if author.get('name')] print(f"\nExtracted {len(author_names)} author names for Bancroft Library cross-reference") # Key target authors mentioned in PLAN target_authors = ['John Haskell Kemble', 'James Miller Guinn'] print(f"\nKey target authors from PLAN: {target_authors}") # Verify target authors are in our list for target in target_authors: if any(target.lower() in name.lower() for name in author_names): print(f"‚úÖ {target} found in author list") else: print(f"‚ùå {target} NOT found in author list") print("\n=== SEARCHING FOR BANCROFT LIBRARY MANUSCRIPT COLLECTION GUIDES ===") print("Focus: Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence from Mexican-American War 1846") print("Cross-reference: California immigration scholars with Bancroft Library guide contributors") # Define search queries for Bancroft Library manuscript guides bancroft_search_queries = [ 'Bancroft Library manuscript collection guides Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo', 'Guides to manuscript collections Bancroft Library University California Vallejo', 'Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence Mexican-American War 1846 Bancroft', 'Bancroft Library Vallejo documents donated manuscript collection', 'University of California Bancroft manuscript guides Vallejo papers', 'Mariano Vallejo correspondence 1846 Mexican War Bancroft Library collection' ] # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Store all search results all_bancroft_results = [] print(f"\nExecuting {len(bancroft_search_queries)} targeted searches for Bancroft Library guides...") for i, query in enumerate(bancroft_search_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(bancroft_search_queries)}: {query}") print("-" * 80) # Try multiple search approaches search_urls = [ f"https://www.google.com/search?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}", f"https://duckduckgo.com/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}" ] for j, search_url in enumerate(search_urls, 1): print(f" Approach {j}: {'Google' if 'google' in search_url else 'DuckDuckGo'}") try: response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Extract search results if 'google' in search_url: # Google search results results = soup.find_all('div', class_='g') print(f" Found {len(results)} Google results") for k, result in enumerate(results[:5], 1): # Top 5 results title_elem = result.find('h3') link_elem = result.find('a') snippet_elem = result.find('span', class_='aCOpRe') or result.find('div', class_='VwiC3b') title = title_elem.get_text() if title_elem else 'No title' link = link_elem.get('href') if link_elem else 'No link' snippet = snippet_elem.get_text() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' print(f" Result {k}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" Link: {link}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}..." if len(snippet) > 150 else f" Snippet: {snippet}") # Check for Bancroft Library relevance combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}".lower() bancroft_indicators = ['bancroft', 'manuscript', 'collection', 'guide', 'vallejo', 'university of california'] relevance_score = sum(1 for indicator in bancroft_indicators if indicator in combined_text) if relevance_score >= 3: print(f" üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE (Score: {relevance_score}/{len(bancroft_indicators)})") # Store result all_bancroft_results.append({ 'search_query': query, 'search_method': 'Google' if 'google' in search_url else 'DuckDuckGo', 'result_number': k, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'relevance_score': relevance_score }) print() else: # DuckDuckGo results (simpler structure) results = soup.find_all('div', class_='result') print(f" Found {len(results)} DuckDuckGo results") for k, result in enumerate(results[:3], 1): # Top 3 results title_elem = result.find('h2') or result.find('a') link_elem = result.find('a') snippet_elem = result.find('div', class_='snippet') title = title_elem.get_text() if title_elem else 'No title' link = link_elem.get('href') if link_elem else 'No link' snippet = snippet_elem.get_text() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' print(f" Result {k}: {title}") print(f" Link: {link}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:100]}..." if len(snippet) > 100 else f" Snippet: {snippet}") print() # Store result all_bancroft_results.append({ 'search_query': query, 'search_method': 'DuckDuckGo', 'result_number': k, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet }) else: print(f" ‚ùå HTTP error: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚ùå Search error: {str(e)}") # Brief pause between requests time.sleep(2) print("=" * 80) time.sleep(3) # Longer pause between different queries print(f"\n=== BANCROFT LIBRARY SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY ===") print(f"Total search results collected: {len(all_bancroft_results)}") # Save comprehensive search results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") bancroft_results_file = f"workspace/bancroft_library_vallejo_search_{timestamp}.json" with open(bancroft_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_focus': 'Bancroft Library manuscript collection guides for Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence', 'target_period': '1846 Mexican-American War', 'cross_reference_authors': author_names, 'key_target_authors': target_authors, 'total_queries_executed': len(bancroft_search_queries), 'total_results_found': len(all_bancroft_results), 'search_queries': bancroft_search_queries, 'all_search_results': all_bancroft_results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"üìÅ Bancroft Library search results saved to: {bancroft_results_file}") # Analyze results for high-relevance Bancroft Library connections high_relevance_results = [r for r in all_bancroft_results if r.get('relevance_score', 0) >= 3] print(f"\nüéØ High-relevance results found: {len(high_relevance_results)}") if high_relevance_results: print("\nMost promising Bancroft Library manuscript guide connections:") for i, result in enumerate(high_relevance_results[:5], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['search_query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Relevance Score: {result.get('relevance_score', 'N/A')}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") print(f"\nüìã NEXT PHASE: Cross-reference author analysis") print(f"üéØ Goal: Identify which California immigration scholars contributed to Bancroft Library manuscript guides") print(f"üìö Focus: Guides specifically indexing Vallejo's 1846 wartime correspondence and donated documents") print(f"\nüîç Ready to analyze specific Bancroft Library URLs and cross-reference with author list")
Execution Output

2025-08-06 23:32:10
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 3)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from datetime import datetime import time # Extract author information from workspace files print("=== EXTRACTING AUTHOR INFORMATION FROM WORKSPACE FILES ===") # Load the author analysis file to get complete list of California immigration scholars author_analysis_file = 'workspace/california_immigration_analysis_20250806_232732.json' with open(author_analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: author_data = json.load(f) print(f"Loading author data from: {author_analysis_file}") print(f"Total unique authors found in previous research: {author_data['total_unique_authors']}") # Extract the complete list of potential authors potential_authors = author_data['potential_authors'] print("\nComplete list of California immigration scholars to cross-reference:") for i, author in enumerate(potential_authors, 1): author_name = author.get('name', 'Unknown') confidence = author.get('confidence', 'Unknown') source = author.get('source', 'Unknown') print(f"{i:2d}. {author_name} (Confidence: {confidence}, Source: {source})") # Create a clean list of author names for searching author_names = [author.get('name', '') for author in potential_authors if author.get('name')] print(f"\nExtracted {len(author_names)} author names for Bancroft Library cross-reference") # Key target authors mentioned in PLAN target_authors = ['John Haskell Kemble', 'James Miller Guinn'] print(f"\nKey target authors from PLAN: {target_authors}") # Verify target authors are in our list - FIXED the variable scope error for target_author in target_authors: if any(target_author.lower() in name.lower() for name in author_names): print(f"‚úÖ {target_author} found in author list") else: print(f"‚ùå {target_author} NOT found in author list") print("\n=== SEARCHING FOR BANCROFT LIBRARY MANUSCRIPT COLLECTION GUIDES ===") print("Focus: Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence from Mexican-American War 1846") print("Cross-reference: California immigration scholars with Bancroft Library guide contributors") # Define search queries for Bancroft Library manuscript guides bancroft_search_queries = [ 'Bancroft Library manuscript collection guides Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo', 'Guides to manuscript collections Bancroft Library University California Vallejo', 'Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence Mexican-American War 1846 Bancroft', 'Bancroft Library Vallejo documents donated manuscript collection', 'University of California Bancroft manuscript guides Vallejo papers', 'Mariano Vallejo correspondence 1846 Mexican War Bancroft Library collection' ] # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Store all search results all_bancroft_results = [] print(f"\nExecuting {len(bancroft_search_queries)} targeted searches for Bancroft Library guides...") for i, query in enumerate(bancroft_search_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(bancroft_search_queries)}: {query}") print("-" * 80) # Use DuckDuckGo search which is more reliable for automated queries try: search_url = f"https://duckduckgo.com/html/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}" print(f" Searching: {search_url[:100]}...") response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=20) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Extract DuckDuckGo search results results = soup.find_all('div', class_='web-result') or soup.find_all('div', class_='result') print(f" Found {len(results)} search results") if not results: # Try alternative selectors for DuckDuckGo results results = soup.find_all('h2', class_='result__title') or soup.find_all('a', class_='result__a') print(f" Alternative search found {len(results)} results") for j, result in enumerate(results[:5], 1): # Top 5 results # Extract title, link, and snippet with multiple fallback strategies title_elem = result.find('h2') or result.find('a') or result.find('h3') link_elem = result.find('a') snippet_elem = result.find('div', class_='result__snippet') or result.find('span', class_='result__snippet') title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' link = link_elem.get('href') if link_elem else 'No link' snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' # Clean up the link if it's a DuckDuckGo redirect if link.startswith('//'): link = 'https:' + link elif link.startswith('/l/?uddg='): # Extract actual URL from DuckDuckGo redirect import urllib.parse try: parsed = urllib.parse.parse_qs(link.split('?')[1]) if 'uddg' in parsed: link = urllib.parse.unquote(parsed['uddg'][0]) except: pass print(f" Result {j}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" Link: {link}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}..." if len(snippet) > 150 else f" Snippet: {snippet}") # Check for Bancroft Library relevance combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}".lower() bancroft_indicators = ['bancroft', 'manuscript', 'collection', 'guide', 'vallejo', 'university of california', 'berkeley', 'donated'] relevance_score = sum(1 for indicator in bancroft_indicators if indicator in combined_text) if relevance_score >= 3: print(f" üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE (Score: {relevance_score}/{len(bancroft_indicators)})") # Check for author cross-references author_matches = [] for author_name in author_names: if len(author_name) > 5 and author_name.lower() in combined_text: author_matches.append(author_name) if author_matches: print(f" üë§ AUTHOR MATCHES FOUND: {author_matches}") # Store result all_bancroft_results.append({ 'search_query': query, 'search_number': i, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'author_matches': author_matches if 'author_matches' in locals() else [] }) print() else: print(f" ‚ùå HTTP error: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚ùå Search error: {str(e)}") # Brief pause between queries to be respectful time.sleep(3) print("=" * 80) print(f"\n=== BANCROFT LIBRARY SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY ===") print(f"Total search results collected: {len(all_bancroft_results)}") # Save comprehensive search results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") bancroft_results_file = f"workspace/bancroft_library_vallejo_search_{timestamp}.json" with open(bancroft_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_focus': 'Bancroft Library manuscript collection guides for Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence', 'target_period': '1846 Mexican-American War', 'cross_reference_authors': author_names, 'key_target_authors': target_authors, 'total_queries_executed': len(bancroft_search_queries), 'total_results_found': len(all_bancroft_results), 'search_queries': bancroft_search_queries, 'all_search_results': all_bancroft_results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"üìÅ Bancroft Library search results saved to: {bancroft_results_file}") # Analyze results for high-relevance Bancroft Library connections high_relevance_results = [r for r in all_bancroft_results if r.get('relevance_score', 0) >= 3] print(f"\nüéØ High-relevance results found: {len(high_relevance_results)}") # Analyze author cross-references author_cross_references = [r for r in all_bancroft_results if r.get('author_matches', [])] print(f"üë§ Results with author cross-references: {len(author_cross_references)}") if high_relevance_results: print("\nMost promising Bancroft Library manuscript guide connections:") for i, result in enumerate(high_relevance_results[:5], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['search_query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Relevance Score: {result.get('relevance_score', 'N/A')}") if result.get('author_matches'): print(f" Author Matches: {result['author_matches']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if author_cross_references: print(f"\nüë§ AUTHOR CROSS-REFERENCE ANALYSIS:") for result in author_cross_references: print(f"\n‚Ä¢ {result['title']}") print(f" Authors found: {result['author_matches']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Query: {result['search_query']}") print(f"\nüìã SEARCH PHASE COMPLETE") print(f"üéØ Goal: Cross-reference California immigration scholars with Bancroft Library manuscript guide contributors") print(f"üìö Focus: Guides specifically indexing Vallejo's 1846 wartime correspondence and donated documents") print(f"\nüîç Next step: Analyze specific Bancroft Library URLs for detailed author attribution") print(f"üìä Results ready for detailed analysis in {bancroft_results_file}")

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution failed - NameError on line 39 due to undefined variable 'target_author' in the list comprehension. The code successfully extracted author information from workspace files and identified 17 California immigration scholars including the key target authors John Haskell Kemble and James Miller Guinn. However, the script crashed before reaching the Bancroft Library search phase due to a simple variable scope error in the target author verification loop. The error prevents any of the planned Bancroft Library manuscript guide searches from executing. **PLAN** alignment: 30% complete - author extraction successful but core search functionality blocked by syntax error. Immediate fix needed: Change the loop variable from 'target_author' to 'target' in the list comprehension on line 39 to match the for loop variable, or restructure the verification logic. Once this simple variable name fix is applied, the comprehensive Bancroft Library search queries are ready to execute and should produce the needed cross-reference data for Vallejo's wartime correspondence guides.
Python Code python
import os import json import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from datetime import datetime import time # Extract author information from workspace files print("=== EXTRACTING AUTHOR INFORMATION FROM WORKSPACE FILES ===") # Load the author analysis file to get complete list of California immigration scholars author_analysis_file = 'workspace/california_immigration_analysis_20250806_232732.json' with open(author_analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: author_data = json.load(f) print(f"Loading author data from: {author_analysis_file}") print(f"Total unique authors found in previous research: {author_data['total_unique_authors']}") # Extract the complete list of potential authors potential_authors = author_data['potential_authors'] print("\nComplete list of California immigration scholars to cross-reference:") for i, author in enumerate(potential_authors, 1): author_name = author.get('name', 'Unknown') confidence = author.get('confidence', 'Unknown') source = author.get('source', 'Unknown') print(f"{i:2d}. {author_name} (Confidence: {confidence}, Source: {source})") # Create a clean list of author names for searching author_names = [author.get('name', '') for author in potential_authors if author.get('name')] print(f"\nExtracted {len(author_names)} author names for Bancroft Library cross-reference") # Key target authors mentioned in PLAN target_authors = ['John Haskell Kemble', 'James Miller Guinn'] print(f"\nKey target authors from PLAN: {target_authors}") # Verify target authors are in our list - FIXED the variable scope error for target_author in target_authors: if any(target_author.lower() in name.lower() for name in author_names): print(f"‚úÖ {target_author} found in author list") else: print(f"‚ùå {target_author} NOT found in author list") print("\n=== SEARCHING FOR BANCROFT LIBRARY MANUSCRIPT COLLECTION GUIDES ===") print("Focus: Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence from Mexican-American War 1846") print("Cross-reference: California immigration scholars with Bancroft Library guide contributors") # Define search queries for Bancroft Library manuscript guides bancroft_search_queries = [ 'Bancroft Library manuscript collection guides Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo', 'Guides to manuscript collections Bancroft Library University California Vallejo', 'Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence Mexican-American War 1846 Bancroft', 'Bancroft Library Vallejo documents donated manuscript collection', 'University of California Bancroft manuscript guides Vallejo papers', 'Mariano Vallejo correspondence 1846 Mexican War Bancroft Library collection' ] # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Store all search results all_bancroft_results = [] print(f"\nExecuting {len(bancroft_search_queries)} targeted searches for Bancroft Library guides...") for i, query in enumerate(bancroft_search_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(bancroft_search_queries)}: {query}") print("-" * 80) # Use DuckDuckGo search which is more reliable for automated queries try: search_url = f"https://duckduckgo.com/html/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}" print(f" Searching: {search_url[:100]}...") response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=20) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Extract DuckDuckGo search results results = soup.find_all('div', class_='web-result') or soup.find_all('div', class_='result') print(f" Found {len(results)} search results") if not results: # Try alternative selectors for DuckDuckGo results results = soup.find_all('h2', class_='result__title') or soup.find_all('a', class_='result__a') print(f" Alternative search found {len(results)} results") for j, result in enumerate(results[:5], 1): # Top 5 results # Extract title, link, and snippet with multiple fallback strategies title_elem = result.find('h2') or result.find('a') or result.find('h3') link_elem = result.find('a') snippet_elem = result.find('div', class_='result__snippet') or result.find('span', class_='result__snippet') title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' link = link_elem.get('href') if link_elem else 'No link' snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' # Clean up the link if it's a DuckDuckGo redirect if link.startswith('//'): link = 'https:' + link elif link.startswith('/l/?uddg='): # Extract actual URL from DuckDuckGo redirect import urllib.parse try: parsed = urllib.parse.parse_qs(link.split('?')[1]) if 'uddg' in parsed: link = urllib.parse.unquote(parsed['uddg'][0]) except: pass print(f" Result {j}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" Link: {link}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}..." if len(snippet) > 150 else f" Snippet: {snippet}") # Check for Bancroft Library relevance combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}".lower() bancroft_indicators = ['bancroft', 'manuscript', 'collection', 'guide', 'vallejo', 'university of california', 'berkeley', 'donated'] relevance_score = sum(1 for indicator in bancroft_indicators if indicator in combined_text) if relevance_score >= 3: print(f" üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE (Score: {relevance_score}/{len(bancroft_indicators)})") # Check for author cross-references author_matches = [] for author_name in author_names: if len(author_name) > 5 and author_name.lower() in combined_text: author_matches.append(author_name) if author_matches: print(f" üë§ AUTHOR MATCHES FOUND: {author_matches}") # Store result all_bancroft_results.append({ 'search_query': query, 'search_number': i, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'author_matches': author_matches if 'author_matches' in locals() else [] }) print() else: print(f" ‚ùå HTTP error: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚ùå Search error: {str(e)}") # Brief pause between queries to be respectful time.sleep(3) print("=" * 80) print(f"\n=== BANCROFT LIBRARY SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY ===") print(f"Total search results collected: {len(all_bancroft_results)}") # Save comprehensive search results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") bancroft_results_file = f"workspace/bancroft_library_vallejo_search_{timestamp}.json" with open(bancroft_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_focus': 'Bancroft Library manuscript collection guides for Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence', 'target_period': '1846 Mexican-American War', 'cross_reference_authors': author_names, 'key_target_authors': target_authors, 'total_queries_executed': len(bancroft_search_queries), 'total_results_found': len(all_bancroft_results), 'search_queries': bancroft_search_queries, 'all_search_results': all_bancroft_results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"üìÅ Bancroft Library search results saved to: {bancroft_results_file}") # Analyze results for high-relevance Bancroft Library connections high_relevance_results = [r for r in all_bancroft_results if r.get('relevance_score', 0) >= 3] print(f"\nüéØ High-relevance results found: {len(high_relevance_results)}") # Analyze author cross-references author_cross_references = [r for r in all_bancroft_results if r.get('author_matches', [])] print(f"üë§ Results with author cross-references: {len(author_cross_references)}") if high_relevance_results: print("\nMost promising Bancroft Library manuscript guide connections:") for i, result in enumerate(high_relevance_results[:5], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['search_query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Relevance Score: {result.get('relevance_score', 'N/A')}") if result.get('author_matches'): print(f" Author Matches: {result['author_matches']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if author_cross_references: print(f"\nüë§ AUTHOR CROSS-REFERENCE ANALYSIS:") for result in author_cross_references: print(f"\n‚Ä¢ {result['title']}") print(f" Authors found: {result['author_matches']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Query: {result['search_query']}") print(f"\nüìã SEARCH PHASE COMPLETE") print(f"üéØ Goal: Cross-reference California immigration scholars with Bancroft Library manuscript guide contributors") print(f"üìö Focus: Guides specifically indexing Vallejo's 1846 wartime correspondence and donated documents") print(f"\nüîç Next step: Analyze specific Bancroft Library URLs for detailed author attribution") print(f"üìä Results ready for detailed analysis in {bancroft_results_file}")

Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 4)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from datetime import datetime import time # Extract author information from workspace files print("=== EXTRACTING AUTHOR INFORMATION FROM WORKSPACE FILES ===") # Load the author analysis file to get complete list of California immigration scholars author_analysis_file = 'workspace/california_immigration_analysis_20250806_232732.json' with open(author_analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: author_data = json.load(f) print(f"Loading author data from: {author_analysis_file}") print(f"Total unique authors found in previous research: {author_data['total_unique_authors']}") # Extract the complete list of potential authors potential_authors = author_data['potential_authors'] print("\nComplete list of California immigration scholars to cross-reference:") for i, author in enumerate(potential_authors, 1): author_name = author.get('name', 'Unknown') confidence = author.get('confidence', 'Unknown') source = author.get('source', 'Unknown') print(f"{i:2d}. {author_name} (Confidence: {confidence}, Source: {source})") # Create a clean list of author names for searching author_names = [author.get('name', '') for author in potential_authors if author.get('name')] print(f"\nExtracted {len(author_names)} author names for Bancroft Library cross-reference") # Key target authors mentioned in PLAN target_authors = ['John Haskell Kemble', 'James Miller Guinn'] print(f"\nKey target authors from PLAN: {target_authors}") # Verify target authors are in our list - FIXED the variable scope error for target in target_authors: found = False for name in author_names: if target.lower() in name.lower(): found = True break if found: print(f"‚úÖ {target} found in author list") else: print(f"‚ùå {target} NOT found in author list") print("\n=== SEARCHING FOR BANCROFT LIBRARY MANUSCRIPT COLLECTION GUIDES ===") print("Focus: Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence from Mexican-American War 1846") print("Cross-reference: California immigration scholars with Bancroft Library guide contributors") # Define search queries for Bancroft Library manuscript guides bancroft_search_queries = [ 'Bancroft Library manuscript collection guides Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo', 'Guides to manuscript collections Bancroft Library University California Vallejo', 'Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence Mexican-American War 1846 Bancroft', 'Bancroft Library Vallejo documents donated manuscript collection', 'University of California Bancroft manuscript guides Vallejo papers', 'Mariano Vallejo correspondence 1846 Mexican War Bancroft Library collection', 'John Haskell Kemble Bancroft Library manuscript guides', 'James Miller Guinn Bancroft Library collection guides' ] # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Store all search results all_bancroft_results = [] print(f"\nExecuting {len(bancroft_search_queries)} targeted searches for Bancroft Library guides...") for i, query in enumerate(bancroft_search_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(bancroft_search_queries)}: {query}") print("-" * 80) # Use DuckDuckGo search which is more reliable for automated queries try: search_url = f"https://duckduckgo.com/html/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}" print(f" Searching: {search_url[:100]}...") response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=20) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Extract DuckDuckGo search results with multiple fallback strategies results = soup.find_all('div', class_='web-result') if not results: results = soup.find_all('div', class_='result') if not results: results = soup.find_all('h2', class_='result__title') if not results: # Try finding any divs or sections that contain links results = soup.find_all('a', href=True) results = [r for r in results if r.get_text().strip() and len(r.get_text().strip()) > 10][:10] print(f" Found {len(results)} search results") for j, result in enumerate(results[:5], 1): # Top 5 results # Extract title, link, and snippet with multiple fallback strategies if result.name == 'a': title = result.get_text().strip() link = result.get('href') snippet = '' # Try to find snippet in parent or sibling elements parent = result.parent if parent: snippet_elem = parent.find('div') or parent.find('span') if snippet_elem: snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() else: title_elem = result.find('h2') or result.find('a') or result.find('h3') link_elem = result.find('a') snippet_elem = result.find('div', class_='result__snippet') or result.find('span', class_='result__snippet') or result.find('div') title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' link = link_elem.get('href') if link_elem else 'No link' snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' # Clean up the link if it's a DuckDuckGo redirect if link and link.startswith('//'): link = 'https:' + link elif link and link.startswith('/l/?uddg='): # Extract actual URL from DuckDuckGo redirect import urllib.parse try: parsed = urllib.parse.parse_qs(link.split('?')[1]) if 'uddg' in parsed: link = urllib.parse.unquote(parsed['uddg'][0]) except: pass # Skip if title is too short or generic if not title or len(title) < 10 or title.lower() in ['no title', 'unknown']: continue print(f" Result {j}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" Link: {link}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}..." if len(snippet) > 150 else f" Snippet: {snippet}") # Check for Bancroft Library relevance combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}".lower() bancroft_indicators = ['bancroft', 'manuscript', 'collection', 'guide', 'vallejo', 'university of california', 'berkeley', 'donated', 'wartime', 'correspondence'] relevance_score = sum(1 for indicator in bancroft_indicators if indicator in combined_text) # Check for author cross-references author_matches = [] for author_name in author_names: if len(author_name) > 5 and author_name.lower() in combined_text: author_matches.append(author_name) if relevance_score >= 3: print(f" üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE (Score: {relevance_score}/{len(bancroft_indicators)})") if author_matches: print(f" üë§ AUTHOR MATCHES FOUND: {author_matches}") # Store result all_bancroft_results.append({ 'search_query': query, 'search_number': i, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'author_matches': author_matches }) print() else: print(f" ‚ùå HTTP error: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚ùå Search error: {str(e)}") # Brief pause between queries to be respectful time.sleep(3) print("=" * 80) print(f"\n=== BANCROFT LIBRARY SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY ===") print(f"Total search results collected: {len(all_bancroft_results)}") # Save comprehensive search results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") bancroft_results_file = f"workspace/bancroft_library_vallejo_search_{timestamp}.json" with open(bancroft_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_focus': 'Bancroft Library manuscript collection guides for Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence', 'target_period': '1846 Mexican-American War', 'cross_reference_authors': author_names, 'key_target_authors': target_authors, 'total_queries_executed': len(bancroft_search_queries), 'total_results_found': len(all_bancroft_results), 'search_queries': bancroft_search_queries, 'all_search_results': all_bancroft_results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"üìÅ Bancroft Library search results saved to: {bancroft_results_file}") # Analyze results for high-relevance Bancroft Library connections high_relevance_results = [r for r in all_bancroft_results if r.get('relevance_score', 0) >= 3] print(f"\nüéØ High-relevance results found: {len(high_relevance_results)}") # Analyze author cross-references author_cross_references = [r for r in all_bancroft_results if r.get('author_matches', [])] print(f"üë§ Results with author cross-references: {len(author_cross_references)}") if high_relevance_results: print("\nMost promising Bancroft Library manuscript guide connections:") for i, result in enumerate(high_relevance_results[:5], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['search_query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Relevance Score: {result.get('relevance_score', 'N/A')}") if result.get('author_matches'): print(f" Author Matches: {result['author_matches']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if author_cross_references: print(f"\nüë§ AUTHOR CROSS-REFERENCE ANALYSIS:") for result in author_cross_references: print(f"\n‚Ä¢ {result['title']}") print(f" Authors found: {result['author_matches']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Query: {result['search_query']}") # Create summary of findings for the PLAN print(f"\nüìã SEARCH PHASE COMPLETE - PLAN PROGRESS SUMMARY") print(f"‚úÖ Successfully extracted {len(author_names)} California immigration scholars from workspace") print(f"‚úÖ Confirmed key targets John Haskell Kemble and James Miller Guinn in author list") print(f"‚úÖ Executed {len(bancroft_search_queries)} targeted Bancroft Library searches") print(f"‚úÖ Found {len(high_relevance_results)} high-relevance results for manuscript guides") print(f"‚úÖ Identified {len(author_cross_references)} potential author cross-references") print(f"\nüéØ PLAN OBJECTIVE: Cross-reference California immigration scholars with Bancroft Library guide contributors") print(f"üìö FOCUS: Guides indexing Vallejo's 1846 wartime correspondence and donated documents") print(f"\nüìä Results ready for detailed analysis in {bancroft_results_file}") print(f"üîç Next phase: Analyze specific Bancroft Library URLs for detailed author attribution")
Execution Output

Tester Feedback
Tester Feedback:
Execution partially successful - Code ran without errors and completed the author extraction and search execution phases. The script successfully loaded 17 California immigration scholars from workspace files and confirmed key targets John Haskell Kemble and James Miller Guinn are present. However, there are significant technical issues preventing full PLAN completion: (1) A 'combined_text' variable scope error occurred during result processing, causing search analysis to fail, (2) Multiple HTTP 202 errors from DuckDuckGo indicating rate limiting or blocking, (3) Zero high-relevance results and zero author cross-references were identified due to the processing failures. **PLAN** alignment: 60% complete - author extraction and search queries executed successfully, but result analysis and cross-referencing failed. The search did find some promising results like 'PDF The Vallejo Documentos' and 'A guide to the manuscript collections : Bancroft Library', but processing errors prevented proper analysis. Immediate fixes needed: (1) Define 'combined_text' variable before the relevance scoring section, (2) Add better error handling for HTTP issues, (3) Implement alternative search strategies to avoid rate limiting. The comprehensive results file was saved successfully for future analysis.
Python Code python
import os import json import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from datetime import datetime import time # Extract author information from workspace files print("=== EXTRACTING AUTHOR INFORMATION FROM WORKSPACE FILES ===") # Load the author analysis file to get complete list of California immigration scholars author_analysis_file = 'workspace/california_immigration_analysis_20250806_232732.json' with open(author_analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: author_data = json.load(f) print(f"Loading author data from: {author_analysis_file}") print(f"Total unique authors found in previous research: {author_data['total_unique_authors']}") # Extract the complete list of potential authors potential_authors = author_data['potential_authors'] print("\nComplete list of California immigration scholars to cross-reference:") for i, author in enumerate(potential_authors, 1): author_name = author.get('name', 'Unknown') confidence = author.get('confidence', 'Unknown') source = author.get('source', 'Unknown') print(f"{i:2d}. {author_name} (Confidence: {confidence}, Source: {source})") # Create a clean list of author names for searching author_names = [author.get('name', '') for author in potential_authors if author.get('name')] print(f"\nExtracted {len(author_names)} author names for Bancroft Library cross-reference") # Key target authors mentioned in PLAN target_authors = ['John Haskell Kemble', 'James Miller Guinn'] print(f"\nKey target authors from PLAN: {target_authors}") # Verify target authors are in our list - FIXED the variable scope error for target in target_authors: found = False for name in author_names: if target.lower() in name.lower(): found = True break if found: print(f"‚úÖ {target} found in author list") else: print(f"‚ùå {target} NOT found in author list") print("\n=== SEARCHING FOR BANCROFT LIBRARY MANUSCRIPT COLLECTION GUIDES ===") print("Focus: Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence from Mexican-American War 1846") print("Cross-reference: California immigration scholars with Bancroft Library guide contributors") # Define search queries for Bancroft Library manuscript guides bancroft_search_queries = [ 'Bancroft Library manuscript collection guides Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo', 'Guides to manuscript collections Bancroft Library University California Vallejo', 'Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence Mexican-American War 1846 Bancroft', 'Bancroft Library Vallejo documents donated manuscript collection', 'University of California Bancroft manuscript guides Vallejo papers', 'Mariano Vallejo correspondence 1846 Mexican War Bancroft Library collection', 'John Haskell Kemble Bancroft Library manuscript guides', 'James Miller Guinn Bancroft Library collection guides' ] # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Store all search results all_bancroft_results = [] print(f"\nExecuting {len(bancroft_search_queries)} targeted searches for Bancroft Library guides...") for i, query in enumerate(bancroft_search_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(bancroft_search_queries)}: {query}") print("-" * 80) # Use DuckDuckGo search which is more reliable for automated queries try: search_url = f"https://duckduckgo.com/html/?q={requests.utils.quote(query)}" print(f" Searching: {search_url[:100]}...") response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=20) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Extract DuckDuckGo search results with multiple fallback strategies results = soup.find_all('div', class_='web-result') if not results: results = soup.find_all('div', class_='result') if not results: results = soup.find_all('h2', class_='result__title') if not results: # Try finding any divs or sections that contain links results = soup.find_all('a', href=True) results = [r for r in results if r.get_text().strip() and len(r.get_text().strip()) > 10][:10] print(f" Found {len(results)} search results") for j, result in enumerate(results[:5], 1): # Top 5 results # Extract title, link, and snippet with multiple fallback strategies if result.name == 'a': title = result.get_text().strip() link = result.get('href') snippet = '' # Try to find snippet in parent or sibling elements parent = result.parent if parent: snippet_elem = parent.find('div') or parent.find('span') if snippet_elem: snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() else: title_elem = result.find('h2') or result.find('a') or result.find('h3') link_elem = result.find('a') snippet_elem = result.find('div', class_='result__snippet') or result.find('span', class_='result__snippet') or result.find('div') title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' link = link_elem.get('href') if link_elem else 'No link' snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' # Clean up the link if it's a DuckDuckGo redirect if link and link.startswith('//'): link = 'https:' + link elif link and link.startswith('/l/?uddg='): # Extract actual URL from DuckDuckGo redirect import urllib.parse try: parsed = urllib.parse.parse_qs(link.split('?')[1]) if 'uddg' in parsed: link = urllib.parse.unquote(parsed['uddg'][0]) except: pass # Skip if title is too short or generic if not title or len(title) < 10 or title.lower() in ['no title', 'unknown']: continue print(f" Result {j}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" Link: {link}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}..." if len(snippet) > 150 else f" Snippet: {snippet}") # Check for Bancroft Library relevance combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}".lower() bancroft_indicators = ['bancroft', 'manuscript', 'collection', 'guide', 'vallejo', 'university of california', 'berkeley', 'donated', 'wartime', 'correspondence'] relevance_score = sum(1 for indicator in bancroft_indicators if indicator in combined_text) # Check for author cross-references author_matches = [] for author_name in author_names: if len(author_name) > 5 and author_name.lower() in combined_text: author_matches.append(author_name) if relevance_score >= 3: print(f" üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE (Score: {relevance_score}/{len(bancroft_indicators)})") if author_matches: print(f" üë§ AUTHOR MATCHES FOUND: {author_matches}") # Store result all_bancroft_results.append({ 'search_query': query, 'search_number': i, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'author_matches': author_matches }) print() else: print(f" ‚ùå HTTP error: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚ùå Search error: {str(e)}") # Brief pause between queries to be respectful time.sleep(3) print("=" * 80) print(f"\n=== BANCROFT LIBRARY SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY ===") print(f"Total search results collected: {len(all_bancroft_results)}") # Save comprehensive search results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") bancroft_results_file = f"workspace/bancroft_library_vallejo_search_{timestamp}.json" with open(bancroft_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_focus': 'Bancroft Library manuscript collection guides for Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence', 'target_period': '1846 Mexican-American War', 'cross_reference_authors': author_names, 'key_target_authors': target_authors, 'total_queries_executed': len(bancroft_search_queries), 'total_results_found': len(all_bancroft_results), 'search_queries': bancroft_search_queries, 'all_search_results': all_bancroft_results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"üìÅ Bancroft Library search results saved to: {bancroft_results_file}") # Analyze results for high-relevance Bancroft Library connections high_relevance_results = [r for r in all_bancroft_results if r.get('relevance_score', 0) >= 3] print(f"\nüéØ High-relevance results found: {len(high_relevance_results)}") # Analyze author cross-references author_cross_references = [r for r in all_bancroft_results if r.get('author_matches', [])] print(f"üë§ Results with author cross-references: {len(author_cross_references)}") if high_relevance_results: print("\nMost promising Bancroft Library manuscript guide connections:") for i, result in enumerate(high_relevance_results[:5], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Query: {result['search_query']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Relevance Score: {result.get('relevance_score', 'N/A')}") if result.get('author_matches'): print(f" Author Matches: {result['author_matches']}") print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if author_cross_references: print(f"\nüë§ AUTHOR CROSS-REFERENCE ANALYSIS:") for result in author_cross_references: print(f"\n‚Ä¢ {result['title']}") print(f" Authors found: {result['author_matches']}") print(f" Link: {result['link']}") print(f" Query: {result['search_query']}") # Create summary of findings for the PLAN print(f"\nüìã SEARCH PHASE COMPLETE - PLAN PROGRESS SUMMARY") print(f"‚úÖ Successfully extracted {len(author_names)} California immigration scholars from workspace") print(f"‚úÖ Confirmed key targets John Haskell Kemble and James Miller Guinn in author list") print(f"‚úÖ Executed {len(bancroft_search_queries)} targeted Bancroft Library searches") print(f"‚úÖ Found {len(high_relevance_results)} high-relevance results for manuscript guides") print(f"‚úÖ Identified {len(author_cross_references)} potential author cross-references") print(f"\nüéØ PLAN OBJECTIVE: Cross-reference California immigration scholars with Bancroft Library guide contributors") print(f"üìö FOCUS: Guides indexing Vallejo's 1846 wartime correspondence and donated documents") print(f"\nüìä Results ready for detailed analysis in {bancroft_results_file}") print(f"üîç Next phase: Analyze specific Bancroft Library URLs for detailed author attribution")
Execution Output
Code Output: === EXTRACTING AUTHOR INFORMATION FROM WORKSPACE FILES === Loading author data from: workspace_webshaper_9/california_immigration_analysis_20250806_232732.json Total unique authors found in previous research: 17 Complete list of California immigration scholars to cross-reference: 1. The Making (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 2. San Francisco Daily (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 3. Cosmopolitan California (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 4. An Analysis (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 5. John Haskell Kemble (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 6. The Panama Route (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 7. Migration System The (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 8. Mexican Migration Project (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 9. Historical Impact (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 10. California Gold Rush (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 11. John Bidwell (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 12. John Bartleson (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 13. Economy In (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 14. The California Gold (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 15. Immigrant California (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 16. James Miller Guinn (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) 17. The Sonoran Migration (Confidence: Unknown, Source: Unknown) Extracted 17 author names for Bancroft Library cross-reference Key target authors from PLAN: ['John Haskell Kemble', 'James Miller Guinn'] ‚úÖ John Haskell Kemble found in author list ‚úÖ James Miller Guinn found in author list === SEARCHING FOR BANCROFT LIBRARY MANUSCRIPT COLLECTION GUIDES === Focus: Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence from Mexican-American War 1846 Cross-reference: California immigration scholars with Bancroft Library guide contributors Executing 8 targeted searches for Bancroft Library guides... Search 1/8: Bancroft Library manuscript collection guides Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Searching: https://duckduckgo.com/html/?q=Bancroft%20Library%20manuscript%20collection%20guides%20Mariano%20Gua... Found 10 search results Result 1: Title: PDF The Vallejo 'Documentos' - indexes.montereyhistory.org Link: https://indexes.montereyhistory.org/sites/default/files/peninsula-diary/1954/3-12-1954.pdf Snippet: PDF The Vallejo 'Documentos' - indexes.montereyhistory.org indexes.montereyhistory.org/sites/default/files/penins... ‚ùå Search error: name 'combined_text' is not defined ================================================================================ Search 2/8: Guides to manuscript collections Bancroft Library University California Vallejo -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Searching: https://duckduckgo.com/html/?q=Guides%20to%20manuscript%20collections%20Bancroft%20Library%20Univers... Found 10 search results Result 1: Title: A guide to the manuscript collections : Bancroft Library : Free ... Link: https://archive.org/details/guidetomanuscrip0001banc Snippet: A guide to the manuscript collections : Bancroft Library : Free ... archive.org/details/guidetomanuscrip0001banc ... ‚ùå Search error: name 'combined_text' is not defined ================================================================================ Search 3/8: Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence Mexican-American War 1846 Bancroft -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Searching: https://duckduckgo.com/html/?q=Mariano%20Guadalupe%20Vallejo%20wartime%20correspondence%20Mexican-Am... Found 10 search results Result 1: Title: Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo - American Literature - Oxford Bibliographies Link: https://www.oxfordbibliographies.com/abstract/document/obo-9780199827251/obo-9780199827251-0138.xml Snippet: Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo - American Literature - Oxford Bibliographies www.oxfordbibliographies.com/abstract/doc... ‚ùå Search error: name 'combined_text' is not defined ================================================================================ Search 4/8: Bancroft Library Vallejo documents donated manuscript collection -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Searching: https://duckduckgo.com/html/?q=Bancroft%20Library%20Vallejo%20documents%20donated%20manuscript%20col... 2025-08-06 23:36:59
Code Execution - Plan #2 (Iteration 5)
Executing development phase code:
Python Code python
import os import json import requests from bs4 import BeautifulSoup from datetime import datetime import time import urllib.parse # Extract author information from workspace files print("=== EXTRACTING AUTHOR INFORMATION FROM WORKSPACE FILES ===") # Load the author analysis file to get complete list of California immigration scholars author_analysis_file = 'workspace/california_immigration_analysis_20250806_232732.json' with open(author_analysis_file, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f: author_data = json.load(f) print(f"Loading author data from: {author_analysis_file}") print(f"Total unique authors found in previous research: {author_data['total_unique_authors']}") # Extract the complete list of potential authors potential_authors = author_data['potential_authors'] print("\nComplete list of California immigration scholars to cross-reference:") for i, author in enumerate(potential_authors, 1): author_name = author.get('name', 'Unknown') confidence = author.get('confidence', 'Unknown') source = author.get('source', 'Unknown') print(f"{i:2d}. {author_name} (Confidence: {confidence}, Source: {source})") # Create a clean list of author names for searching author_names = [author.get('name', '') for author in potential_authors if author.get('name')] print(f"\nExtracted {len(author_names)} author names for Bancroft Library cross-reference") # Key target authors mentioned in PLAN target_authors = ['John Haskell Kemble', 'James Miller Guinn'] print(f"\nKey target authors from PLAN: {target_authors}") # Verify target authors are in our list - using proper loop structure for target in target_authors: found = False for name in author_names: if target.lower() in name.lower(): found = True break if found: print(f"‚úÖ {target} found in author list") else: print(f"‚ùå {target} NOT found in author list") print("\n=== SEARCHING FOR BANCROFT LIBRARY MANUSCRIPT COLLECTION GUIDES ===") print("Focus: Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence from Mexican-American War 1846") print("Cross-reference: California immigration scholars with Bancroft Library guide contributors") # Headers for web requests headers = { 'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36' } # Store all search results all_bancroft_results = [] # Try direct access to known Bancroft Library resources first print("\n=== PHASE 1: DIRECT ACCESS TO BANCROFT LIBRARY RESOURCES ===") bancroft_direct_urls = [ 'https://oac.cdlib.org/findaid/ark:/13030/tf1c6003w8/', # Vallejo family papers 'https://oac.cdlib.org/findaid/ark:/13030/tf1c6003w8/admin/', 'https://catalog.library.berkeley.edu/search~S1?/avallejo/avallejo/1%2C124%2C124%2CB/frameset&FF=avallejo+mariano+guadalupe+1808+1890&1%2C1%2C', 'https://www.lib.berkeley.edu/libraries/bancroft-library', 'https://oac.cdlib.org/institutions/UC+Berkeley::Bancroft+Library' ] for i, url in enumerate(bancroft_direct_urls, 1): print(f"\n{i}. Accessing Bancroft resource: {url}") try: response = requests.get(url, headers=headers, timeout=20) if response.status_code == 200: print(f" ‚úÖ Successfully accessed (Content length: {len(response.content):,} bytes)") soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') page_title = soup.find('title') print(f" Page title: {page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else 'Unknown'}") # Save the HTML for analysis filename = f"bancroft_direct_{i}.html" filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) with open(filepath, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: f.write(response.text) print(f" üìÅ Saved to: {filename}") # Look for guide-related keywords and author names page_text = soup.get_text().lower() guide_keywords = ['guide', 'manuscript', 'collection', 'vallejo', 'correspondence', 'wartime', '1846', 'mexican war'] found_keywords = [] for keyword in guide_keywords: if keyword in page_text: found_keywords.append(keyword) print(f" üéØ Found guide keywords: {found_keywords}") # Check for author cross-references author_matches = [] for author_name in author_names: if len(author_name) > 5 and author_name.lower() in page_text: author_matches.append(author_name) if author_matches: print(f" üë§ AUTHOR MATCHES FOUND: {author_matches}") # Store result all_bancroft_results.append({ 'source': 'direct_access', 'url': url, 'title': page_title.get_text().strip() if page_title else 'Unknown', 'keywords_found': found_keywords, 'author_matches': author_matches, 'relevance_score': len(found_keywords), 'file_saved': filename }) elif response.status_code == 404: print(f" ‚ùå Page not found (404)") else: print(f" ‚ùå HTTP error: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚ùå Error accessing URL: {str(e)}") time.sleep(2) print("\n=== PHASE 2: TARGETED WEB SEARCH FOR BANCROFT GUIDES ===") # Use alternative search approach with Google Scholar and Archive.org search_queries = [ 'site:oac.cdlib.org "Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo" manuscript guide', 'site:archive.org "Bancroft Library" "manuscript collections" guide', 'site:berkeley.edu "Vallejo papers" "Bancroft Library" 1846', '"John Haskell Kemble" "Bancroft Library" manuscript guide', '"James Miller Guinn" "Bancroft Library" collection guide' ] for i, query in enumerate(search_queries, 1): print(f"\nSearch {i}/{len(search_queries)}: {query}") print("-" * 80) try: # Use Google search with site restrictions search_url = f"https://www.google.com/search?q={urllib.parse.quote(query)}" print(f" Searching: {search_url}") response = requests.get(search_url, headers=headers, timeout=15) if response.status_code == 200: soup = BeautifulSoup(response.content, 'html.parser') # Extract Google search results results = soup.find_all('div', class_='g') or soup.find_all('div', class_='tF2Cxc') print(f" Found {len(results)} Google results") for j, result in enumerate(results[:3], 1): # Top 3 results title_elem = result.find('h3') or result.find('h2') link_elem = result.find('a') snippet_elem = result.find('span', class_='aCOpRe') or result.find('div', class_='VwiC3b') or result.find('span', class_='st') title = title_elem.get_text().strip() if title_elem else 'No title' link = link_elem.get('href') if link_elem else 'No link' snippet = snippet_elem.get_text().strip() if snippet_elem else 'No snippet' # Skip if title is too short if not title or len(title) < 10: continue print(f" Result {j}:") print(f" Title: {title}") print(f" Link: {link}") print(f" Snippet: {snippet[:150]}..." if len(snippet) > 150 else f" Snippet: {snippet}") # FIXED: Define combined_text before using it combined_text = f"{title} {snippet}".lower() # Check for Bancroft Library relevance bancroft_indicators = ['bancroft', 'manuscript', 'collection', 'guide', 'vallejo', 'university of california', 'berkeley', 'donated', 'wartime', 'correspondence'] relevance_score = sum(1 for indicator in bancroft_indicators if indicator in combined_text) # Check for author cross-references author_matches = [] for author_name in author_names: if len(author_name) > 5 and author_name.lower() in combined_text: author_matches.append(author_name) if relevance_score >= 3: print(f" üéØ HIGH RELEVANCE (Score: {relevance_score}/{len(bancroft_indicators)})") if author_matches: print(f" üë§ AUTHOR MATCHES FOUND: {author_matches}") # Store result all_bancroft_results.append({ 'source': 'web_search', 'search_query': query, 'search_number': i, 'result_number': j, 'title': title, 'link': link, 'snippet': snippet, 'relevance_score': relevance_score, 'author_matches': author_matches }) print() else: print(f" ‚ùå HTTP error: {response.status_code}") except Exception as e: print(f" ‚ùå Search error: {str(e)}") # Longer pause to avoid rate limiting time.sleep(5) print("=" * 80) print(f"\n=== BANCROFT LIBRARY SEARCH RESULTS SUMMARY ===") print(f"Total search results collected: {len(all_bancroft_results)}") # Save comprehensive search results timestamp = datetime.now().strftime("%Y%m%d_%H%M%S") bancroft_results_file = f"workspace/bancroft_library_vallejo_search_{timestamp}.json" with open(bancroft_results_file, 'w', encoding='utf-8') as f: json.dump({ 'search_timestamp': datetime.now().isoformat(), 'search_focus': 'Bancroft Library manuscript collection guides for Mariano Guadalupe Vallejo wartime correspondence', 'target_period': '1846 Mexican-American War', 'cross_reference_authors': author_names, 'key_target_authors': target_authors, 'total_results_found': len(all_bancroft_results), 'direct_access_attempts': len(bancroft_direct_urls), 'web_search_queries': len(search_queries), 'all_search_results': all_bancroft_results }, f, indent=2, ensure_ascii=False) print(f"üìÅ Bancroft Library search results saved to: {bancroft_results_file}") # Analyze results for high-relevance Bancroft Library connections high_relevance_results = [r for r in all_bancroft_results if r.get('relevance_score', 0) >= 3] print(f"\nüéØ High-relevance results found: {len(high_relevance_results)}") # Analyze author cross-references author_cross_references = [r for r in all_bancroft_results if r.get('author_matches', [])] print(f"üë§ Results with author cross-references: {len(author_cross_references)}") if high_relevance_results: print("\nMost promising Bancroft Library manuscript guide connections:") for i, result in enumerate(high_relevance_results[:5], 1): print(f"\n{i}. {result['title']}") print(f" Source: {result['source']}") if result['source'] == 'web_search': print(f" Query: {result['search_query']}") print(f" Link: {result.get('link', result.get('url', 'N/A'))}") print(f" Relevance Score: {result.get('relevance_score', 'N/A')}") if result.get('author_matches'): print(f" Author Matches: {result['author_matches']}") if result.get('snippet'): print(f" Snippet: {result['snippet'][:200]}..." if len(result['snippet']) > 200 else f" Snippet: {result['snippet']}") if author_cross_references: print(f"\nüë§ AUTHOR CROSS-REFERENCE ANALYSIS:") for result in author_cross_references: print(f"\n‚Ä¢ {result['title']}") print(f" Authors found: {result['author_matches']}") print(f" Link: {result.get('link', result.get('url', 'N/A'))}") print(f" Source: {result['source']}") # Create comprehensive summary for PLAN completion print(f"\nüìã COMPREHENSIVE SEARCH PHASE COMPLETE - PLAN PROGRESS SUMMARY") print(f"‚úÖ Successfully extracted {len(author_names)} California immigration scholars from workspace") print(f"‚úÖ Confirmed key targets John Haskell Kemble and James Miller Guinn in author list") print(f"‚úÖ Attempted direct access to {len(bancroft_direct_urls)} Bancroft Library resources") print(f"‚úÖ Executed {len(search_queries)} targeted web searches for manuscript guides") print(f"‚úÖ Found {len(high_relevance_results)} high-relevance results for manuscript guides") print(f"‚úÖ Identified {len(author_cross_references)} potential author cross-references") print(f"\nüéØ PLAN OBJECTIVE: Cross-reference California immigration scholars with Bancroft Library guide contributors") print(f"üìö FOCUS: Guides specifically indexing Vallejo's 1846 wartime correspondence and donated documents") print(f"\nüìä Results ready for detailed analysis in {bancroft_results_file}") print(f"üîç Files saved to workspace for further investigation of specific Bancroft Library manuscript guides") # List all files created for reference workspace_files = [f for f in os.listdir('workspace') if f.startswith('bancroft_')] print(f"\nüìÅ Bancroft Library research files created:") for filename in workspace_files: filepath = os.path.join('workspace', filename) file_size = os.path.getsize(filepath) print(f" - {filename} ({file_size:,} bytes)")
Execution Output
